All quantitative determinations were done in triplicates, and the data are presented as the mean Â± standard deviation. Statistical analysis was done using one-way ANOVA. Differences at P < 0.05 were considered statistically significant. Principal component analysis (PCA) modeling was calculated based on the algorithm presented [ 19]. PCA is among the common exploratory data analysis methods in chemometrics. PCA establishes a set of new variables, called principal components (PCs), to represent the main and important variation in data. The mathematical transformation of an original data matrix (
X ) by PCA can be expressed as the following equation as mentioned in a study of Brereton, R. G. [ 20].
